abstract.p: Theater critic Ginia Bellafante lists which plays or actors will win, should win and should have been nominated for Tony Awards; drawing (M)

block.p: BEST PLAY Will win: ''The Coast of Utopia'' Should win: ''The Coast of Utopia'' Should have been nominated: ''The Clean House'' *
BEST MUSICAL Will win: ''Spring Awakening'' Should win: ''Grey Gardens'' Should have been nominated: ''In the Heights'' *
BEST PLAY REVIVAL Will win: ''Journey's End'' Should win: ''Translations'' Should have been nominated: ''A Moon for the Misbegotten''
BEST MUSICAL REVIVAL Will win: ''110 in the Shade'' Should win: ''Company'' Should have been nominated: None
BEST ACTOR IN A PLAY: Will win: Frank Langella, ''Frost/Nixon'' Should win: Liev Schreiber, ''Talk Radio'' Should have been nominated: Michael Sheen, ''Frost/Nixon''
BEST ACTRESS IN A PLAY Will win: Julie White, ''The Little Dog Laughed'' Should win: Eve Best, ''A Moon for the Misbegotten'' Should have been nominated: Alison Pill, ''Blackbird'' *
BEST ACTOR IN A MUSICAL Will win: Raúl Esparza, ''Company'' Should win: Raúl Esparza, ''Company'' Should have been nominated: Lin-Manuel Miranda, ''In the Heights''
BEST ACTRESS IN A MUSICAL Will win: Christine Ebersole, ''Grey Gardens'' Should win: Christine Ebersole, ''Grey Gardens'' Should have been nominated: None
BEST DIRECTOR OF A PLAY Will win: Jack O'Brien, ''The Coast of Utopia'' Should win: Jack O'Brien, ''The Coast of Utopia'' Should have been nominated: Howard Davies, ''A Moon for the Misbegotten''
BEST DIRECTOR OF A MUSICAL Will win: Michael Mayer, ''Spring Awakening'' Should win: John Doyle, ''Company'' Should have been nominated: Thomas Kail, ''In the Heights'' *

*For the ''Should have neen nominated'' category, the critics were allowed to expand the potential nominees to Off Broadway productions that were actually ineligible for the Broadway-only Tony Awards.
